Dear @Abdulrahim Alblooshi <mailto:Abdulrahim.Alblooshi@gig-gulf.com> ,

 

Please note that subject shipment is under customs inspection. All the boxes in the pallet are in good condition.

 

Customs opened 3 intact boxes, but item found damage in one of the boxes. (attached FYR)

As the shipment is in customs inspection area is not allowed for the agent to take more pictures or they cannot open and check the inner content of the remaining boxes.

 

Kuwait airways informed us they will not issue damage certificate for the same as they are not responsible for inner content in the cartons. The outer cartons are in well condition.

Dear Ahmed  

Thank you for the notification. 

We have registered the claim under reference  23/MO/17781 

May we request for the following details: 

•                     Incident Report: Brief description of the incident clarifying when and where the loss was first noticed. 

•                     Photographs of the damaged cargo 

•                     Photographs (at the time of loading at the source and at the time of offloading at the final destination) 

•                     Damage Certificate from the carrier 

•                     Commercial Invoice and Packing List 

•                     Customs Receipt - at source and destination 

•                     Proof of delivery (if not claused, reason for not clausing) 

•                     Immediate notice of loss against carriers (or the local agents of the carriers) 

•                     Report from concerned authority (police/ customs/ terminal operator/ stevedores etc.) 

•                     Details of contact person and location (if a Loss Adjuster is to be appointed) 

•                     Claim Bill 

 

We look forward to hearing from you. 

Kindly note that the above communication or requirements are not exhaustive. Issued on a “without prejudice” basis.

 

Thanks & Regards,

Dear @Vic Eldrin Munar <Vic.Munar@gig-gulf.com> <mailto:Vic.Munar@gig-gulf.com> ,

 

Hope this mail finds you well.

 

Please note that subject shipment is under customs inspection. All the boxes in the pallet are in good condition.

 

Customs opened 3 intact boxes, but item found damage in one of the boxes. (attached FYR)

As the shipment is in customs inspection area are agent not allowed to take more pictures or they cannot open and check the inner content of the remaining boxes.

 

Kuwait airways informed us they will not issue damage certificate for the same as they are not responsible for inner content in the cartons. The outer cartons are in well condition.

 

Kindly advise do we need to cancel shipment release so that insurance team can do the survey and check the cargo at airport, or we need to proceed with the shipment delivery without damage certificate.

 

Regards,

 

 

AHMED KHALED​​​​

COORDINATOR ‑ SHIPPING

REAL FZE

DUBAI
